  • â€œAI might be the most transformational economic cultural force of our lifetime.â€

  • â€œOpen source is the way everyone from a kid in a in their bedroom or their dorm room all the way to a startup to all the way to somebody who wants a you know lower cost of inference in their IoT device or robotic startup that's what they're using for context too much of the internet runs on open source software right so the server software and other things much of that is open source the protocols are all open for the internet.â€
  • â€œThe Biden team really looked as AI as something to be centralized and controlled. Everything was about how do we make sure that we regulate these three or four companies and only three or four companies can build AI.â€
  • â€œCentral planning tends to lead to very bad economic outcomes.â€
  • â€œWe are in a race with China and there are going to be catastrophic consequences if Chinese models are running on every robot, every camera, every car, every device around the world and we just got to face that reality.â€
  • â€œI would much rather have you know them using a model built by somebody who kind of agrees with us and has our values.â€
  • â€œWe want to win.â€
  • â€œMore eyes make every bug shallow.â€

  • â€œChris's new book, The Sirens Call, is about the way our attention has been bought, sold, and overwhelmed.â€

  • â€œTo me, the sort of question about all this stuff is one of the theses of the book is that there's this kind of disconnect between what we will pay attention to. And in some volitional sense, what we want to pay attention to.â€
  • â€œacquisition and retention are different things.â€
  • â€œI have the same faith as you that fundamentally there's something irreducibly human and that people are going to just rebel.â€

  • â€œthe move from public posting to group chat is I think 100% driven by that.â€
  • â€œWe tend to conflate, particularly this era, like useful tech and lucrative tech.â€
  • â€œThe word privacy doesn't appear once in the Constitution. And the reason why is because at the time it wasn't used in the sense that we mean it, which is the right to live as a stranger among strangers.â€
  • â€œI think the nation state is cracking up in a way just to get Doomer for a second. And I think the internet is definitely behind part of it because you don't have the sense of collective consensus that the media and TV, for example, used to create during the Cronkite era.â€
  • â€œI mean, Peter Thiel famously asked the question, we're promised flying cars and we got 140 characters.â€
  • â€œGrowth for the sake of growth is the ideology of the cancer cell.â€

  • "Claude Code is not only the most powerful coding agent in the world, but it's also the most powerful all-purpose agent that can control your computer through the terminal."
  • "And you don't need to have any coding experience to use the most powerful AI agent in the world."
  • "It's becoming more and more clear that Claude code is becoming the everything agent. It is the everything agent and I totally believe that."
  • "This is an agent that I can just tell to do something. It creates the to-do list. And what we'll talk about later when we start building apps is we can actually change it to plan mode, right? We can we can change it. We can change the mode that it uses to plan. And so it won't actually just begin. It'll just tell us the plan and then we can approve the plan."
